headline: Southern Dill Potato Salad
description: This dill potato salad recipe mixes Dijon mustard, cider vinegar, and celery salt to add flavor to a tangy dill dressing for red potatoes and eggs.
name: Southern Dill Potato Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, or to taste
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, or to taste
salt and black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes in a large pot, cover them with water, and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until the potatoes are cooked through but still firm, about 20 minutes. Remove from the water, let cool, and cut potatoes into chunks. Set aside.
Stir together sour cream, mayonnaise, onion, celery, vinegar, mustard, celery salt, and salt and pepper in a bowl until well mixed.
Place potatoes and eggs in a large salad bowl, and sprinkle with dried dill. Pour the dressing over the potatoes and eggs, and mix lightly.
Cover and refrigerate the salad for at least 30 minutes. Serve cold.

review.reviewBody: Add diced dill pickles, and bacon bits..Mouth watering 😋
It was delicious, evryone in my family loved it.

OUTSTANDING!!!! I used fresh dug taters and fresh dill from my garden. I used more dill than the recipe called for since I love dill. I must admit though, it's as good warm as it was after it was refrigerated. This is definitely my new "go to" tater salad.

Delish. Very creamy without feeling too heavy! Tasted better as each day passed!!

Notes: 
Used fresh dill from my garden instead of dried
Didn't have sour cream so used Greek Yogurt.
Added chopped pickles, pickle juice and capers

This is really good potato salad! Excellent recipe for some of the garden potatoes hubby is digging up right now. I adjusted the recipe to make for 4-6. Used fresh dill weed and parsley since I have lots ready in the garden. The celery salt and Dijon mustard are great in this! Don’t skip those two ingredients! This is my go-to potato salad from now on!
Added sliced olives. Used red onions instead of yellow onions. Used Mrs. Dash: Lemon pepper, garlic blend and original seasonings. Used actual dill pickles with garlic and dill in it.

We very much enjoy this recipe. My wife has a milk protein allergy and I am lactose intolerant. We substituted pre-made slaw dressing from the grocery store for the sour cream. It thins the dressing nicely and makes it sweeter than sour cream would.
Best ever! This will be my go to potato salad from now on.

Whoa my goodness!!! Best potato salad ever!!! Wow! Followed recipe exactly except used 1/4 cup less mayo and used 1/4 cup organic Ceaser dressing to make up for the full 3/4 cup mayo. Also used 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar. Not sure if that made any difference. I didn't need to add regular salt since the celery salt, and lots of pepper were great. I'm usually picky about potato salad. This one knocks it out the park!!!

I love potato salad but usually avoid it because of the heavy mayo. So glad I tried this recipe! I substituted the sour cream with whole plain yogurt to up the protein and added in some Worcestershire sauce and cayenne pepper to give it a bit of a kick. It was awesome!

My husband wanted a dill potato salad. I found this one and he is in love!! We all are. I love the combination of the Mayo, sour cream, and mustard. It’s tart but not like mustard potato salad. I would have made it as written except I didn’t have Dijon, so I substituted with spicy brown mustard. I can’t compare the two but it was fantastic the way I made it. It’s now on my favorites list and I make it every time we smoke chicken, pork, or brisket (which seems to be almost every weekend)!!

This is a nice potato salad. The sour cream cuts through the mayo very well. I don’t cut the potatoes to small of a dice - leaves it a little more rustic. I also add a dill pickle finely diced, 1 tablespoon pickle juice, and a teaspoon of smoked honey for a sweet bite. Excellent.

I had leftover dill and decided to give this a try, it was amazing. I used russet potatoes, halved the recipe and added green onion and some lemon juice to the dressing. I don’t really think you can go wrong with this one as long as you taste the dressing and adjust for personal preferences. Had to smack hubby away before I even got it in the fridge he was about 5 spoonfuls deep and telling me we could eat it warm... at 9am.

My mom made the BEST potato salad. Sadly, she passed away without leaving a recipe. I can make it come very close, but it makes a huge amount. Your recipe is great and scaled down in quantity! I was hesitant about sour cream, but it’s just a perfect blend. Thanks for sharing this tasty recipe that brings back the flavors of my childhood!
Easy and delicious. Crowd pleaser. Loved the dill. I had never added dill to potato salad before. But I am always looking for a change to the same old thing.

This is gooooooddd!! I absolutely love dill and will use this recipe from now on for potato salad! I made it as written but next time I make it will probably add some bacon for some extra flavor!! Thanks!!

I made it with fresh dill from our herb garden, and also used green onions instead of the white onion. I made it the night before so the flavors had a chance to meld. We couldn't get enough of this potato salad. It's a keeper for our house.

I haven’t made this yet but the secret to any potato salad is to prepare the sauce separate from the potatoes 
(Add a little pickle juice),trace of sugar, sour cream with the mayo and yellow mustard 
S&P. Modify to taste before you fold into potatoes

Oh My Goodness!! 
I made the recipes as directed, ( except I didn't have any celery) Absolutely the best I've ever had! The BF came along and added mined garlic, capers and a bit of dill relish! It was so good, that I had to have a dish warm. Can't wait to take it out of the fridge tomorrow !! Perfect as written!

we used 1/3 c. of mayo and 1/3 c. of dijon mustard ... also, diced the potatoes. it was the perfect amount of "sauce" to coat the potatoes and onion. I would add another stalk of celery next time. super good.

Outstanding!
My wife is a southern girl and said it was her favorite potato salad ever.
Followed the recipe with exception of using fresh dill and low fat mayo.

I wanted a different potato salad to serve at a recent get together and made this just as the recipe stated; made no changes. It was a hit and everyone raved about it. I saved this one and will definitely make it again!
I could not add the sour cream due to health issues, but without that one ingredient this salad was absolutely DELICIOUS!

This is the recipe I’ve been searching for years to find! It’s a fabulous potato salad! I made my second batch last night for a family gathering and told my husband that this could become one of my “signature” dishes. The dressing really makes it, not too heavy and the right amount of dill weed.

This is the best potato salad I've ever made, or even eaten for that matter! I substituted Greek yogurt for the sour cream and it came out perpfectly. The fresh dill was amazing. Thanks for such a great recipe!
Very tasty.

Love this recipe, I had been looking for a great potato salad recipe for some time because I'm so picky about my potato salad.
 I have made with eggs & without, great both ways. I added more celery, and top with green onion if I've got some on hand.
So stinking good! I love potato salad but the few times in my life I have attempted to make it they were huge fails...this recipe has changed my potato salad making pattern!
Perfect. Dont change anything. The recipe is perfect the wayit is
I like the eggy taste of this recipe. Thought it needed more mustard and celery salt so added 1 Tbsp more mustard and 1 tsp more celery salt which helped.

The only change I made was to cut the recipe down and use my left over baked potatoes instead of cooking up fresh ones. This turned out nice and creamy with a lovely dill taste. I woulnd't change a thing.
Loved this potato salad. Made it for a party and it was a hit. Will definitely be making this one again.
I'm not a huge potato salad fan at all but I love this recipe and everyone that has ever tried it loves it. Any holidays or special occasions that come up I'm always asked to make this.
Very good potato Salad! I love the addition of the dill. It could have used a little more dressing though. I also suggest cubing the potatoes before boiling.
I used red onion instead of white and 3 tablespoons of fresh dill instead of dried dill. I also used lawry's garlic salt instead of regular salt. it came out delicious .
It was delicious ?? I used two stalks of celery and red instead of white onion. My husband loved it too, next time we will try it with half the mayo, as it was a little to greasy for our taste.
We loved it! I wanted it to taste like my mom used to make and this was really close. We ended up giving it a lot more salt for a more savory taste. I loved the fresh dill in the salad!!

I've grown weary of the regular potato salad and have gone thru 100lbs of potatoes searching for one with sour cream, dill weed and a bit of tang. This is it! No more searching and recipe saved. Should've known it would come from next door, WTG SPANISH FORT!!! Absolutely delish just as written but you can fiddle with it and get wonderful results too.

Very good. I ended up using a higher dressing to potato ratio (about half again as much), but my red potatoes were pretty big. I also added an extra egg and some additional celery, just because I like those, but I suspect that for most people the written proportions may be perfect. My vinegar and mustard “to taste” meant that I added a little extra. Also, I had only celery seed, so I added somewhat less of that. I made 1/2 of a recipe, and it would make six to eight pretty generous servings. Next time I may use green onions.
I followed the instructions just minus the onions. This recipe is very tasty. I will make it again.
it is loved by everyone and have loved it more than once

I thought that this recipe was just ok. It needed a lot of help as far as the seasoning goes because I thought that it really lacked flavor of any kind. But I didn’t have any celery salt. I only had celery seed. So I used a lot of extra salt and a ton of celery seed and dill. It is true that it tastes better the second day. And I really enjoyed the dill. I will keep tweaking the seasonings and see if I can master it.
I used chopped, fresh baby dill to taste, and also added half of a chopped red bell pepper. It was delicious!

I made this for my daughter's graduation party. (I multiplied the recipe by 5). We had lots of people and lots of other food there but, this potato salad was a huge hit!! Several people told me it was the best potato salad they had ever had and wanted to know where I got it. I was proud to say I had made it myself. The dressing is what makes it so good.

Simple to put together great taste ... I peeled and cubed my potatoes and steamed in a steamer bag for 4 minutes and set in freezer for a few minutes to cool and added a few dill pickles because I love them !! next time I will use more dill and probably try fresh dill this summer...
way too rich for my taste.
Always delicious. I don’t have celery salt so I used extra celery and a little celery seed

3.28.18 My sour cream was not looking too fresh, so I pitched it and sub’d plain Greek low-fat yogurt which worked fine. I had fresh dill on hand, so I used that (fresh is always better) instead of dried. I just never tire of potato salad like this, just creamy, old-fashioned comfort food. Rocked the carbs today!

A tasty variant of the traditional potato salad. One suggestion, as the internet sends this recipe all over the world, it would be helpful to give a volume or weight for the potatoes. We don't like a lot of dressing, so I reduced the mayo and substituted yogurt for the sour cream. No complaints or leftovers!

I made it with a few changes/additions, but it's a VERY good starting point. I added about a Tbls white sugar, 3/4 cup chopped dill pickle, 1/2 cupped chopped green olive, a minced pickled garlic clove, 1 Tbls yellow mustard and a couple dashes of cayenne. Turned out marvelously.
This is a really yummy potato salad recipe. I did not use the eggs just out of personal preference but the dressing is delicious. I also add a little more celery and onion for crunch.

This is such a great recipe!! As recommended I made the "sauce" as written- no substitutions but I doubled it. My family prefers"mushy" potato salad so I used 10lbs russet potatoes peeled before boiling. I used 10 full eggs and 4 yolk only eggs.

I scaled this down for two. Followed the recipe as written. We aren't big mayo fans, so the mix of mayo & sour cream was right for us. I will try this again but probably add a hint of sweet to the dressing, either honey or a sprinkling of sugar, but that's just us. Otherwise, this was far better than any store bought potato salad.
This was truly delicious. My boyfriend said he wanted leftovers (and he never wants that). I think next time I will add just a tad more mustard..but this was over all better than my mother's!

YOU AIN'T JUST WHISTLING DIXIE! THIS STUFF IS THE BOMB! My mother made it the same way, the only way. This potato salad gets better with every passing day, if it makes it past two. I remember eating this stuff for breakfast! I'm so glad you shared this recipe because I only knew how to make it from helping her and never really wrote it down. That's what I love about Allrecipes is that it takes me back and connects me with people who appreciate memories, tradition, and just good food. Thank you.
It was delicious and definitely would make it again.
Delicious recipe! I used fresh dill and added only enough dressing to cover the potatoes. Otherwise it would have been way too moist.

I will definitely make this again, I made a few changes ,as my family is very picky, replaced onions with 1tsp onion powder, and 1/2 tsp shallot salt, and replaced what we call the crunch factor-celery with two large kosher dill pickles, (we prefer valsic brand). No additional salt is needed. As for type of potatoes, my mom always used russet, so 7- 8 large one for this recipe. I made a day ahead, everyone one loved it.
This is the best potato salad recipe I have found

No changes. Everything was perfect! My cooking philosophy goes something like this: If I can't make something in my kitchen that is notably better tasting than what is available pre-made at the grocery store, I will not invest the time and the effort to complete the recipe. 

This recipe would have been worth twice the effort, but fortunately it was as easy as cutting up a few ingredients, and being willing to wait until the next day to eat it! My family loved it, I loved it, and so did my company!
I added a little more dill, celery seed, and mustard to boost the flavors a bit. I also added a little dried cilantro to balance the sour of the mustard and vinegar.
Followed the recipe exactly. Very tasty!

I used 2 sprigs of fresh dill finely chopped and didn't need to use the dried dill at all and 3 hard boiled eggs instead of 5 and this is so good I couldn't stop tasting it before chilling! The dressing tastes a lot like my sour cream cucumber dressing & I'll definitely make it again.
This is a good basic recipe but you'll need to add quite a bit more seasoning to bring the flavour. I also added corn to sweeten things up.
Absolutely delicious!!!!

My biggest problem with this recipe was how many potatoes to put in. Red potatoes come in a variety of sizes. "10 red potatoes" isn't enough information (I did find 3 lb. red potatoes works well). The recipe, as written, is very bland tasting, but apparently a lot of people like bland. I took some reviewers' suggestions and added 1 T. sweet pickle relish, subbed 1/2 of the mayonnaise with Miracle Whip, and added 2 chopped large dill pickles, which improved the flavor significantly. Will add more dill pickles next time. This is a great base recipe that can be tweaked to your liking. It is going into my recipe file.
Delicious! I didn't have celery...the only crunchy veggie I had was red bell pepper, and it was wonderful!! No other changes. This recipe is devine.
I really liked the dill flavor with the onions and celery. It was just the combination I was looking for.
This was perfect! I will use this recipe for years to come.
Be careful with potato cooking time. I don't like mushy potato salad. I overcooked mine by mistake. The cooking time in recipe is right.

We absolutely love this potato salad! I omit the eggs because I can't do hard boiled eggs, but do everything else as written; and I dont do that often. You must use Dukes mayo if you can; because its obviously the best!
I didn't like this recipe and didn't have a very good response from my family about it. It has very little taste, which is surprising, considering the reviews. I won't be making it again.
This was a hit at my mom's for a summer side dish
This was excellent! Only change I made was I feel potato salad needs olives so I added anout 1/2 cup chopped green olives.
I made it just as directed. It was amazing. I don't know why anyone would give it less than 5 stars unless they made it incorrectly.
had to add more dill but it was great

I followed this recipe to a T except I didn't have green onions or celery, so I substituted a shallot. I definitely missed the crunch that the celery would have provided, but it was still delicious. The next time I make it (and I will!), I think I'll use more of a 60/40 mixture of mayo and sour cream, reducing the mayo a bit. I'll also use a bit more dijon.

By far this is the BEST recipie for potato salad I have ever made or eaten. I use a high fat content sour cream and full fat content mayo which makes it taste really creamy, but I think it's the addition of the vinegar that gives it that extra special something. I add the vinegar to the still warm cubed potatoes which gets absorbed while the potatoes cool down. Everyone always asks me to bring the potato salad, it's a golden recipe:)
Thank you to the original poster, it's a fantastic recipe!.
I made the recipe without any changes. It is delicious. My family loved it. I will definitely make it again.
This was delicious! If you use large red potatoes you will NOT need 10. I used 7 med-lge potatoes and kept the dressing amount the same. Perfect. I will definitely make this again.

Holy Cow! This recipe is simply unbelievable. I am a guy and have never made potato salad one time in my life. I love dill and had a taste of a dill potato salad somewhere and I just decided to give it a try. It did not disappoint. After I finished making it I took it in the other room to have my wife taste test it and her eyes lit up. We both could hardly believe what we were tasting. I added a little bit of garlic salt, seasoning salt and a splash of Mrs. Dash. I seriously doubt that I would even try another potato salad recipe as I have found "the one". Much appreciated.
I love this! I don't care if anyone else eats it!
Made the recipe as written. Best potato salad I've ever had. Love the dill and the Dijon. Wouldn't change a thing.
This was awesome!!! Didn't have any Dijon mustard do I used yellow mustard and added a cpl pinches of brown sugar!!! Perfect!!! Also sprinkled the top with paprika for looks!!' Will def make again

I made it this morning, exactly as written except I used fresh dill, to bring to my dad's 70th birthday tonight. Hopefully there is still some left to bring, as I can't stop stealing spoonfuls. SO GOOD. Next time I might chop up a few dill pickles in it for even more dilly goodness and crunch, and maybe up the celery just a bit or add a bit of red bell pepper. I like a little extra crunch.
I have tried several potato salad recipes with various successes. This is my absolute favorite! I love the suggestion of squeezing fresh lemon on it before serving.
Good and basic potato salad. I used all ingredients but to my taste and it turned out great. Family had similar views.
Very tasty. Used green onion instead of white onion.
I made this and I personally don't like it . But my boy friend liked it .
I added 1 tbsp of onion powder and it came out great
Only added 1/2 of the celery salt but increased vinegar and mustard a little. Awesome.

Excellent recipe! I doubled the Dijon, used 2 tsp salt and 1 tsp celery seed instead of celery salt, used a full tsp of black pepper, and added 2 Tbsp sweet relish. After mixing all ingredients I mashed it up slightly with a potato masher while still leaving it quite chunky.
All I did was add about 1/3 c. Of chopped green olives for a little extra zest. Loved it!

I made this as the recipe calls for with the addition of a little horseradish per some of the other review suggestions and it turned out fabulous! I made it a second time with celery seed instead of celery salt due to dietary needs at the time and it wasn't nearly as good. My newest favorite way to make Potato Salad!

This was a good base to go off of for potato salad, but it was definitely missing some things my family likes! I like more hard boiled eggs than is called for, and have to have chunks of dill pickles in mine! I think every bite should have potato, pickle, celery onion and egg in it! The salad was bland, even with the vinegar and dijon, so I added some Miracle Whip for some tang and a whole lot more dijon. I kept tasting it until it was to my liking.

I will first state that I LOVE potato salad, anytime of the year. I have made my mom's recipe for years, sorry mom, but since I found this recipe a few years ago this is in only one I make. The only change I make, which is just a personal preference, I add sweet pickles and a little of the juice to the mayo and sour cream. Otherwise, I follow the recipe exactly.
Yes we used baked potatoes and fresh chives instead of onions. It's delicious for the Summertime meals.

This recipe is great! I love the mayo and sour cream combo flavor is so much better than just mayo. We always have fresh dill in our garden, so it was a great addition to this recipe. I've made it numerous times. We don't care for eggs with our potato salad, so I just omitted them.

Made as directed but accidentally bought celery seed instead of celery salt. It was really good, but kept thinking it needed something more...like thinly sliced radish. If you have a party to go to, you can trust this recipe as is and be a hit.
